intro: Catevala subfasciata, commonly known as the broad-banded cat-eye. It is a species of moth belonging to the family Sphingidae, known for its striking appearance with distinctive eye-like patterns on its wings. The plant it is associated with is typically a flowering plant that provides nectar for the adult moths. Its larvae feed on various plants in the family Fabaceae, such as legumes. The life cycle of Catevala subfasciata is closely tied to the seasonal availability of its host plants.
